meanings.definition: To dry again after having been previously dried.
meanings.sent1: After washing the clothes, she redried them to make sure they were completely dry.
meanings.sent2: The chef redried the herbs before adding them to the dish.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally redried his socks twice, making them extra crispy!
meanings.sent4: The sun redried the wet pavement, turning it into a hot surface.
meanings.sent5: She carefully redried the delicate flowers to preserve their beauty.

meanings.sent1: The redried towel felt rougher than before.
meanings.sent2: The redried fruit had a more concentrated flavor.
meanings.sent3: The redried paint on the wall looked darker than expected.
meanings.sent4: The redried clay sculpture was now stronger and more durable.
meanings.sent5: The redried pasta cooked faster than the fresh one.
